---

**Project Title**: *Ensemble averaging for complex disease prediction in the large p small n domain from multiple data*


Bahareh Khosravi is a member of the HELICAL group as an Early Stage Researcher.

She also is a Ph.D. student in statistics in the department of computer science and statistics at Trinity College Dublin. She graduated from Shiraz University of Medical science with a master’s degree in biostatistics and had completed her bachelor’s duration in statistics.

Her main line of research is focused on models for the vasculitis disease flare prediction harnessing both clinical and environmental data sources.
